result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Valeri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Both counts concurrent to each other
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.    Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.   Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay a total fine of $1492 on each count (including DNA surcharge).   
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $9835.85   plus surcharges.    
*  Pay prosecution costs of $140.00.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: 6 months STAYED.  Credit for 5 days served.  Huber privileges are allowed.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Melowski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statements from: Deborah S., Christina G., Tierney S., Cierra G., Arland T., Matthew T., Susan H., Danielle W., Andee V., Peter V., Nick V., Peter V., Sr., Andrea M., Nancy V.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 7 years WSP concurrent on cts 1 & 2; 4 years initial confinement; 3 years extended supervision; deft is placed on probation for 6 years w/conditions concurrent on cts 1 & 2; 1 year conditional jail w/6 months stayed concurrent on cts 1 & 2, deft to report to jail on 10/22/16 at 6pm, Huber privileges are allowed; credit for 5 days served toward conditional jail time; $1,492.00 total fine/costs on each count (including $250 DNA surcharge each), deft to pay $140.00 prosecution costs (by stipulation of deft); restitution ordered in the amount of $9,835.85 (by stipulation of deft); fine/costs to be paid during period of probation; 2 year revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
